abstracts.cdata!:
Overall, the outcome of the project gave
            satisfactory ratings, with a likely sustainability. Lessons
            indicate that follow-up operations are usually successful,
            as in this case, where the success of the Municipal Funds
            Program, paved the way for the continuation, and expansion
            of the Government's decentralization strategy. However,
            unforeseen changes in the external environment may require
            modifications to the project's operational
            arrangements, when a flexible implementation approach,
            supported by strong Bank's management commitment, may
            prod success. But, the absence of careful supervision, and
            institutional strength in project planning, and in the
            decentralization of rural development resources, may
            jeopardize the returns on community investments, with uneven
            results in the coverage, and quality of infrastructure
            services to be delivered. It is emphasized that simple
            project design, and the promotion of a participatory
            approach in the delivery of basic infrastructure, will
            contribute to greater benefits, enhanced maintenance, and
            sustainability of investments. Although municipalities, and
            state governments demonstrated their ability to proceed with
            project implementation without federal support, the
            monitoring, and evaluation functions were largely lost from
            the federal perspective, due to the absence of central
            coordination. A joint effort by the federal government, and
            the Bank is suggested, to review local legislation, and
            institutional capacities in accessing relevant international
            financing for decentralized programs.
